main event: Two objects the size of a star moved in a northerly direction at low speed, changing in color from blue-white to red.
interesting points: The objects moved in a wavy motion and seemed to go up and down.
The objects were estimated to be at an altitude of 80,000 feet.
The objects were seen to suddenly stop, hover, and then accelerate again to a very high speed of 700-900 mph.
No sound was reported from the objects.
The objects were described as circular in shape and luminous in color.
sighted object: two objects the size of a star
witnesses: multiple witnesses including James Reidel Henderson, a 24-year-old machinist, and Mr. Ronald Brown
